thread.title: Manchester United news: Wayne Rooney will be hurting on the bench, says Rio Ferdinand | Metro News
thread.title_full: Manchester United news: Wayne Rooney will be hurting on the bench, says Rio Ferdinand | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Manchester United news: Wayne Rooney will be hurting on the bench, says Rio Ferdinand | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 9:43 am Wayne Rooney won’t be happy with life on the bench, says Rio Ferdinand (Picture: Getty) 
Wayne Rooney will be hurting at his situation at Manchester United this season, according to former Red Devils defender Rio Ferdinand. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
The England international has had to make do with a place on the bench for much of this campaign, with Jose Mourinho seemingly phasing him out of the first-team. 
Several Chinese Super League clubs have been linked with a move for Rooney, 31, who will not be happy with being relegated to the bench, according to Ferdinand. Rooney recently moved ahead of Bobby Charlton as United’s top scorer in history (Picture: Getty) 
‘Ultimately, Wayne Rooney will be the person who decides when he leaves. He wants to play football, he’s a real good professional. He won’t want to be sitting on the bench… that’ll be hurting him,’ Ferdinand told BT Sport. 
‘He’s got pride, he’s got ego. He wants to get out there playing constantly.
